Module it.polimi.ingsw.am11
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am11.view.client.GUI.windows

Class GamePage

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am11.view.client.GUI.windows.GamePage
public class GamePage extends Object
This class is used to create the page where the game is played.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GamePage()
    This constructor initializes the handIDs list.

  • Constructor Details

    • GamePage

      public GamePage()
      This constructor initializes the handIDs list.

  • Method Details

    • showErrorMessage

      public void showErrorMessage (String message)
      This method is used to show an error message on the screen.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be shown.

    • showLastTurnMessage

      public void showLastTurnMessage (String msg)
      This method is used to show a message on the screen.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to be shown.

    • createGamePage

      public void createGamePage (@NotNull @NotNull CodexNaturalis codexNaturalis)
      This method is used to create the game page in the GUI. It initializes the necessary parts, sets their properties, and prepares the game page for interaction. It also sets up the layout for the page and adds it to the root of the GUI.
      Parameters:
      codexNaturalis - The GUI instance that the game page is a part of.

    • updateDeckTop

      public void updateDeckTop (@NotNull @NotNull PlayableCardType type, GameColor color)
      This method is used to update the top card of the deck in the GUI. It checks the type of the deck (resource or gold) and updates the image of the top card accordingly.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the deck (resource or gold).
      color - The color of the card to be displayed on the top of the deck.

    • updatePersonalObjective

      public void updatePersonalObjective()
      This method is used to update the personal objective card in the GUI. It retrieves the personal objective card from the game model and updates the corresponding image in the GUI.

    • updateHand

      public void updateHand()
      This method is used to update the hand of cards in the GUI. It clears the current hand of cards and retrieves the new hand from the game model. It then updates the corresponding images in the GUI for each card in the hand.

    • updateShownPlayable

      public void updateShownPlayable()
      This method is used to update the visible playable cards in the GUI. It clears the current visible playable cards and retrieves the new visible cards from the game model. It then updates the corresponding images in the GUI for each visible card.

    • placeStarterCard

      public void placeStarterCard()
      This method is used to place the starter card on the game field in the GUI. It retrieves the starter card from the game model and updates the corresponding image in the GUI.

    • printCardsOnField

      public void printCardsOnField (String nickname)
      This method is used to print the cards on the game field in the GUI. It retrieves the field of the player with the given nickname and updates the GUI accordingly. If the current player is viewing their own field and it's their turn, it also creates buttons for available positions.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose field is to be printed.

    • updateTurnChange

      public void updateTurnChange (String nickname)
      This method is used to handle the change of turn in the game. It updates the GUI to reflect the player whose turn it is currently.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose turn it is.

    • updateCommonObj

      public void updateCommonObj()
      This method is used to update the common objective cards in the GUI. It retrieves the common objective cards from the game model and updates the corresponding images in the GUI.

    • updatePlayerPoints

      public void updatePlayerPoints (String nickname, int points)
      This method is used to update the points of a player in the game. It updates the GUI to reflect the current points of the player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose points are to be updated.
      points - The new points of the player.

    • showFieldPl1

      public void showFieldPl1 (javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when player 1's field is clicked in the GUI. It updates the current field being viewed to player 1's field and prints the cards on player 1's field.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • showFieldPl2

      public void showFieldPl2 (javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when player 2's field is clicked in the GUI. It updates the current field being viewed to player 2's field and prints the cards on player 2's field.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • showFieldPl3

      public void showFieldPl3 (javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when player 3's field is clicked in the GUI. It updates the current field being viewed to player 3's field and prints the cards on player 3's field.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • showFieldPl4

      public void showFieldPl4 (javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when player 4's field is clicked in the GUI. It updates the current field being viewed to player 4's field and prints the cards on player 4's field.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • pickFromGoldDeck

      public void pickFromGoldDeck (javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when the gold deck is clicked in the GUI. It sends a request to the game model to draw a card from the gold deck.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • pickFromResDeck

      public void pickFromResDeck (javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when the resource deck is clicked in the GUI. It sends a request to the game model to draw a card from the resource deck.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • chooseVis1

      public void chooseVis1 (javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when the first visible card is clicked in the GUI. It sends a request to the game model to draw a card from the first visible card.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • chooseVis3

      public void chooseVis3 (javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when the third visible card is clicked in the GUI. It sends a request to the game model to draw a card from the third visible card.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • chooseVis2

      public void chooseVis2 (javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when the second visible card is clicked in the GUI. It sends a request to the game model to draw a card from the second visible card.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • chooseVis4

      public void chooseVis4 (javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when the fourth visible card is clicked in the GUI. It sends a request to the game model to draw a card from the fourth visible card.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • card1Selected

      public void card1Selected (@NotNull @NotNull javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when the first card in the hand is selected in the GUI. It handles the selection and flipping of the card.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • card2Selected

      public void card2Selected (@NotNull @NotNull javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when the second card in the hand is selected in the GUI. It handles the selection and flipping of the card.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • card3Selected

      public void card3Selected (@NotNull @NotNull javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is triggered when the third card in the hand is selected in the GUI. It handles the selection and flipping of the card.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • openChatBox

      public void openChatBox (javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is triggered when the chat button is clicked in the GUI. It opens a chat box where the user can send and receive messages. The chat box includes a text field for entering messages, a send button for sending messages, and a close button for closing the chat box. The chat box also displays the chat history.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent object representing the details of the click event.

    • handleComment

      public void handleComment (@NotNull @NotNull javafx.scene.control.TextField commentField)
      This method is used to handle the sending of a message in the chat box. It sends the message to the game model, which then broadcasts it to all players in the game.
      Parameters:
      commentField - The TextField object representing the text field where the message is entered.

    • updateChat

      public void updateChat()
      This method is used to update the chat box in the GUI. It retrieves the chat messages from the game model and updates the chat box in the GUI to display the messages. If a new message is received, it also plays a sound notification.

    • gameEnded

      public void gameEnded()
      This method is triggered when the game ends. It updates the GUI to display the final leaderboard with the players' names and their corresponding scores. It also sets up a close button for the user to exit the game.

    • stopMusic

      public void stopMusic()
      This method is used to stop the music in the game. It checks if the soundtrack player is not null and then stops the music.
